metadata.title: CVE-2022-1852 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s KVM module,which can lead to a denial of service in the x86_emulate_insn inarch/x86/kvm/emulate.c. This flaw occurs while executing an illegalinstruction in guest in the Intel CPU.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1852` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
